item.title: Carm add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Carm add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Carm add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "To announce that there must be no criticism of the President, or that we are to stand by the President, right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Carm add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Carm add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often." -- Mae West

item.title: Carm add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I dwell in possibilityâ€¦" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Carm add a quote by Ashleigh Brilliant
item.description: "I try to take one day at a time, but sometimes several days attack me at once." -- Ashleigh Brilliant

item.title: Carm add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "Living is Easy with Eyes Closed." -- John Lennon

item.title: Carm add a quote by Ben Franklin
item.description: "Instead of cursing the darkness, light a candle." -- Ben Franklin

item.title: Carm add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Carm add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity." -- George Carlin

item.title: Carm add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Everyone looks retarded once you set your mind to it." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Carm add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can stop him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Carm add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Carm add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning do to do afterward." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carm add a quote by A.A. Milne
Carm add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description:
"He has all the virtues I dislike and none of the vices I admire."
<a href="http://www.winston-churchill-leadership.com/churchill-quote-others.html">[On British Labour politician Stafford Cripps.]</a>" -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Carm add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Carm add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Carm add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Carm add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Carm add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Carm add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Carm add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Carm add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Carm add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Carm add a quote by AnaÃ¯s Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naÃ¯ve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- AnaÃ¯s Nin

item.title: Carm add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Carm add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Carm add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Like Lincoln, I would like to believe the ballot is stronger than the bullet. Then again, he said that before he got shot." -- Sarah Vowell
